text: The Kimball mining disaster happened on July 18, 1919, at the Carswell coal mine in Kimball, West Virginia killing six miners. Initial reports said that 221 men had been killed but they were trapped by the explosion. A rescue party was able to dig through the wreckage allowing 215 to return alive to the surface. ==Bibliography== Notes References * \- Total pages: 295 * Category:Coal mining disasters in West Virginia Category:1919 disasters in the United States Category:1919 mining disasters Category:1919 in West Virginia Category:July 1919 events
title: 1919 Kimball mining disaster
